Sentencas: Energetics of Ce-Zr substitution in xCe(0.8)Y(0.2)O(1.9)-(1-x)Zr0.8Y0.2O1.9 (0 <= x <= 1) solid solutions, potential candidates for electrolytes in solid oxide fuel cells, were investigated by high temperature oxide melt drop solution calorimetry.
Titulo: Energetics of cerium-zirconium substitution in the xCe0.8Y0.2O1.9-(1-x)Zr0.8Y0.2O1.9 system

Sentencas: The enthalpies of formation relative to the solid solution end-members, Ce0.8Y0.2O1.9 and Zr0.8Y0.2O1.9 (Delta H-f,H-ss), are slightly positive.
Titulo: Energetics of cerium-zirconium substitution in the xCe0.8Y0.2O1.9-(1-x)Zr0.8Y0.2O1.9 system

Sentencas: The whole substitution range can be divided into three regimes: a zirconia-dominated region (0 <= x < 0.4), where Delta H-f,H-ss increases from 0 to 3.9 kJ/mol; a ceria-dominated region (0.6 <
Titulo: Energetics of cerium-zirconium substitution in the xCe0.8Y0.2O1.9-(1-x)Zr0.8Y0.2O1.9 system

Sentencas: x <= 1), where Delta H-f,H-ss remains nearly constant at 0 to 0.7 kJ/mol; and a transitional region (0.4 <= x <= 0.6), where Delta H-f,H-ss decreases from 3.9 to 0.7 kJ/mol.
Titulo: Energetics of cerium-zirconium substitution in the xCe0.8Y0.2O1.9-(1-x)Zr0.8Y0.2O1.9 system

Sentencas: Such a trend in Delta H-f,H-ss strongly supports a scavenging effect of Zr4+ on oxygen vacancies, i.e. oxygen vacancies prefer the nearest neighboring sites of Zr4+ as in yttria-stabilized zirconia.
Titulo: Energetics of cerium-zirconium substitution in the xCe0.8Y0.2O1.9-(1-x)Zr0.8Y0.2O1.9 system

Sentencas: The formation enthalpy from binary oxides, fluorite CeO2, monoclinic ZrO2 and C-type YO1.5, (Delta H-f,H-ox) is also slightly positive, varying analogously to Delta H-f,H-ss.
Titulo: Energetics of cerium-zirconium substitution in the xCe0.8Y0.2O1.9-(1-x)Zr0.8Y0.2O1.9 system
